Description.val:
The Heavy Tactical Vehicle (HTV) Protection Kit program provides Armor Survivability Suite protection.  HTV Protection Kits include B-Kits (with underbody protection), Fire Suppression, Fuel Tank Fire Suppression (FTFS) Blanket , Fuel Tank Self Sealant (FTSS), and Tank Armor Module (TAM) to enhance survivability.  The Armor Survivability Suite components are mounted to an A-Kit Heavy Tactical Vehicle; which includes Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck (HEMTT), Heavy Equipment Transporter System (HET), Palletized Load System (PLS), Heavy Dump Truck (HDT), and Line Haul configurations to address numerous threats that the DoD has identified.  The Armor Survivability Suite provides occupant protection through enhanced tactical vehicle ballistic protection.

The Medium Tactical Vehicles (MTV) Protection Kit Suite includes an Armor Kit and a Fuel Tank Fire Suppression (FTFS) system. The Armor Kit consists of applique armor panels that are mounted to the FMTV A-Cab exterior to further improve occupant survivability from attack. The FTFS is a ballistic fire protection system designed to cover the fuel tank on the LTAS FMTV. The MTV Protection Kit Suite provides occupant protection through enhanced tactical vehicle ballistic protection. ISO containers are inclusive to facilitate long term storage.

Protection kits were previously part of DA0500 (Family of Heavy Tactical Vehicles) and D15500 (Family of Medium Tactical Vehicles).

Justification.val:
FY 2017 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $49.751 million procures 647 Armor Survivability Suite Protection Kits for Heavy Tactical Vehicles and 344 Protection Kits for Medium Tactical Vehicles to support Active Army units.

FY 2017 OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $101.154 million procures 880 Armor Survivability Suite Protection Kits for Heavy Tactical Vehicles and 492 Protection Kits for Medium Tactical Vehicles to support Active Army units. 

Heavy Tactical Vehicle FY 2017 OCO funding in the amount of $74.035 million is required to support Operation Freedom's Sentinel (OFS) to replace combat losses and washouts from combat operations in theater.  The OFS procurement includes 755 Protection Kits for Heavy Tactical Vehicles.

Heavy Tactical Vehicle FY 2017 OCO funding in the amount of $5.906 million is required to support the Combatant Command (COCOM) requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries and support the European Reassurance Initiative (ERI) in outfitting the pre-positioned equipment sets. There is no excess inventory or viable substitute available to support the ERI requirement. The ERI procurement includes 125 Protection Kits for Heavy Tactical Vehicles.

Medium Tactical Vehicles FY 2017 OCO funding includes $21.213 million to support the COCOM requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries and support the European Reassurance Initiatives (ERI). The ERI procurements include 492 Protection Kits for Medium Tactical Vehicles.

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
February 2017 is the last ordering year for Fidelity Technologies.  A follow on contract is to be determined upon completion of competitive bid process with target award date of June 2017.  

Production rates and lead times are an estimate for the TBD contractor.

Fluctuation in unit cost is caused by model mix.
